summary: A "member of the Committee of the Regions" refers to an individual appointed to represent local and regional authorities within the European Union's institutional framework. This committee serves as an advisory body, providing opinions on legislative proposals that impact regions and municipalities. Members are typically elected officials from EU member states, ensuring that regional perspectives are integrated into EU policy-making. The Committee of the Regions plays a crucial role in enhancing democratic governance and fostering multi-level governance within the EU, thereby promoting the principles of subsidiarity and proportionality in regulatory processes.
